Dear Mrs. Boyer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/5/25, a staff member was involved in a physical intervention
with a youth and did not do this properly.
Investigation Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 1/9/2025. Chief Administrator reported she watched
the video footage of the restraint Staff 1 placed Youth A into in the
kitchen. Chief Administrator reported several concerns after
watching the video footage including improper technique used.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Supervisor reported she was contacted about the
incident and was in communication with Staff 1 and Staff 2 during
the incident. Supervisor reported she checked in on the camera
right after Staff 1 restrained Youth A in the kitchen. Supervisor
reported she did not see the restraint occur but advised Staff 1
and Staff 2 to escort Youth A to her bedroom as there was a lot of
broken items on the kitchen floor.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth A reported Staff 1 placed her in a restraint and
described the restraint as Staff 1 pushing her to the ground.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was in the kitchen “smashing everything”
including breaking the lazy susan, smashing bowls, making
statements of wanting to die. Staff 1 reported he thought Youth A
was going to get a plate or the microwave. Staff 1 reported he
wrapped his arms around Youth A and “put her on the ground”.
Staff 1 explained “put her on the ground” as he leaned down, and
he and Youth A fell to the ground while he had Youth A in a bear
hug position. Staff 1 stated his hold was not a Handle with Care
2

technique. Staff 1 reported it was in the “heat of the moment”, and
he was concerned for Youth A’s safety. He said he was “wrong in
the way” he did the restraint. Staff 1 reported “he thought” he
restrained Youth A in her bedroom when Youth A had a piece of
glass that she held to her throat. Staff 1 reported he yelled for
Staff 2 to come assist due to Youth A having a weapon. Staff 1
reported he restrained Youth A the same way as he did in the
kitchen referencing a bear hug down to the ground. Staff 1
reported the restraint was not a Handle with Care PRT. Staff 1
reported Youth A was not willingly moving with him and Staff 2 to
go to her bedroom. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2 attempted to
move Youth A by lifting under her armpit area.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 2 reported she was in the living room with the other youth in
the house while Staff 1 was in the kitchen with Youth A. Youth A
continued escalating and a five second rule was called for the
other youth in the house to go to their bedrooms for safety. Staff 2
went into the kitchen with Staff 1. As the other youth were walking
to their bedrooms, one youth “spouted off” to Youth A, Youth A
began to try to go after the youth however Staff 2 stepped in front
of Youth A to prevent her from going after the peer. Staff 2
reported Youth A remained in the kitchen and was throwing items
off the kitchen counter onto the floor. Staff 2 reported she did not
view Youth A as “violent” as Youth A was not throwing items at
anyone or across the room, she was just pushing things off the
counter to the floor. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not “super
angry”. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 restrained Youth A and took Youth
A to the floor. Staff 2 reported it happened very fast. Staff 2
described the restraint as Staff 1 placing Youth A in a bear hug
and going to the ground with Youth A on her stomach. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 did not use Handle with Care technique.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was not willing to walk with Staff 1 and
Staff 2 in the escort position. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1
attempted to lift and move Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage in the kitchen on 1/5/2025 was reviewed on
1/9/2025. Youth A was in the kitchen with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Youth A attempted to leave the kitchen and Staff 2 blocked Youth
A from leaving the kitchen by placing her body in between the
refrigerator and countertop island with her right arm on the counter
and left arm bent up to block Youth A. Staff 2 used her body to
prevent Youth A from leaving the area. Youth A walked back to
the counter and hit the window a few times. Youth A began
sliding items off the kitchen counter onto the floor and throwing
3

bowls onto the floor. Youth A hit the counter with her elbows,
threw a pan on the floor, opened the cupboard and threw a stack
of plastic cups on the floor. Youth A went to grab another stack of
plastic cups and Staff 1 went behind Youth A and wrapped his
arms around Youth A’s upper torso then turned Youth A and took
Youth A to the ground. Youth A landed on the ground with Staff
1’s upper body across Youth A’s back. Staff 1 quickly transitioned
off Youth A’s back as Youth A was prone on the ground. Staff 1
knelt over Youth A with his right hand on Youth A’s right lower
back and his left hand bent with his forearm in between Youth A’s
right side and arm. Staff 1 remained in this position for
approximately twenty seconds while he talked to Youth A. Staff 1
removed his hands from Youth A and knelt next to Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Physical Restraint Policy: only physical restraints that are
instructed in the approved Handle with Care Physical
Intervention Manual can be utilized. The Primary Restraint
Technique (PRT) is the preferred method, which is
facilitated by standing behind the youth, hook youths’ arms.
If youth continue to struggle, it may be necessary to
perform a takedown to the floor by stepping back with one
leg, dropping your knee to the ground, dropping the other
nee to the ground and “settling” the youth on the ground
with their legs in front of them. Staff are to avoid sitting or
lying on top of any youth or forcing the youth’s face and
chest down on a flat surface.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Reported for Youth A dated 1/5/2025: Youth A was
breaking household items while making threats of hurting
herself. Youth A grabbed several cups out of the cupboard
and Staff 1 conducted an improper PRT taking Youth A to
the ground.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Reported for Youth A dated 1/5/2025 at 8:05pm: Staff 1
conducted an improper PRT taking Youth A to the ground.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Reported for Youth A dated 1/5/2025 at 9:16pm: Youth A
was in her bedroom attempting to self-harm. Youth A
would not give Staff 1 the nail she had. Staff 1 went to get
the nail and struggled with Youth A for the nail, and both fell
to the ground.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 204620239 dated 1/5/2025 for Youth A:
4

Youth A was in the kitchen tossing items from the counter
and cupboards. Staff 1 put Youth A in a bearhug and took
Youth A down to the floor. Youth A was on her stomach
and Staff 1 immediately let go but kept his hands on Youth
A's back.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 204120238 dated 1/5/2025 for Youth A is
consistent with the facility’s internal incident report for
Youth A dated 1/5/2025 at 9:16pm however the restraint is
marked as standing, not prone.
• Handle with Care Training Manual: PRT is completed by
hooking the youth’s arms.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had disciple dated 8/20/2024
for not reporting a youth having contraband, 1/22/2024 for a
medication error, 2/7/2023 for confidentiality concerns, and
1/6/2025 related to this incident for an unwarranted
restraint, restraint not per technique, prone restraint, and
dragging youth to their bedroom. Staff 1 completed Handle
with Care training on 1/24/2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had one discipline dated
1/6/2025 related to this incident for an unwarranted
restraint, restraint not per technique, prone restraint, and
dragging youth to their bedroom and not intervening. Staff
2 completed Handle with Care training on 7/16/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interview and review
of video footage, Staff 1 placed Youth A in a restraint not per the
facility’s approved Handle with Care technique. Staff 1 placed
Youth A in a bear hug and took her to the ground in the kitchen.
Staff 1 reported he placed Youth A in a restraint in her bedroom
the same way. Video footage of the restraint in the bedroom
cannot be seen as the bedrooms do not have cameras however
Youth A can be seen laying on the ground and Staff 1 next to her
from the hallway video camera footage.
The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to escort and move Youth A when Youth A was not
compliant and walking with them and the facility’s restraint model
does not teach a technique for transporting a youth who is not
complying.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth would not stand up and the staff member dragged the
youth to their room.
Investigation Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 1/9/2025. Chief Administrator reported she watched
the video footage of the restraint Staff 1 did on Youth A while in
the kitchen. Chief Administrator reported several concerns after
watching the video footage including Staff 1 dragging Youth A
across the floor.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Supervisor reported she did not watch the whole
incident while it was happening at the facility. Supervisor reported
she was not aware Staff 1 dragged Youth A to her bedroom until
video footage was reviewed. Supervisor reported Staff 1 has
been trained and knows that it is not acceptable to drag youth.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth A reported Staff 1 dragged her to her bedroom.
Youth A reported Staff 2 was present and witnessed Staff 1
dragging her to her bedroom. Youth A reported Staff 1 had ahold
of her arms while Youth A was laying on the floor on her back.
Youth A reported Staff 1 pulled her to her bedroom. Youth A
reported Staff 2 was trying to keep her from getting loose by
holding her feet. Youth A reported while she was in her bedroom,
Staff 1 “shoved” her, so she punched Staff 1 in the face. Youth A
reported Staff 1 “shoved” her several times while she was in her
bedroom when she was trying to rip the trim off and break the
window. Youth A did not recall how many times Staff 1 “shoved”
her. Youth A reported Staff 2 never “pushed” or “shoved” her.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 1 reported after he restrained Youth A in the kitchen,
Supervisor informed him and Staff 2 to escort Youth A to her
6

bedroom. Staff 1 reported he grabbed Youth A’s wrist and slid her
across the floor to Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 1 reported he and
Staff 2 attempted to escort Youth A however Youth A went “limp”
and he and Staff 2 were unable to lift Youth A. Staff 1 reported he
did not know that he was not allowed to drag youth at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 2 reported after Staff 1 restrained Youth A in the kitchen,
Supervisor came over the intercom and told Staff 1 and Staff 2 to
escort Youth A to her bedroom. Staff 2 reported she was on one
side of Youth A and Staff 1 was on the other. Staff 1 and Staff 2
hooked Youth A’s arms with their arms. Staff 2 reported Youth A
did not stand up and was “going limp”. Staff 2 reported she and
Staff 1 moved Youth A to the entry way. Staff 2 reported once
Youth A was in the entry way, Youth A was asked to get up
several times and walk to her bedroom. Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted again to assist Youth A up into an escort hold and
Youth A stomped on Staff 2’s foot. Staff 2 reported she and Staff
1 set Youth A back down on the ground. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was sitting on the ground and Staff 1 was trying to talk to Youth A.
Youth A took off her sock and wrapped it around her neck. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 grabbed the sock away from Youth A. Staff 1
grabbed Youth A’s arms and dragged Youth A across the living
room floor to her bedroom. Staff 2 reported she followed Staff 1
and Youth A. Staff 2 reported she did not know what to do as the
incident happened so fast. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 had been
talking very calmly to Youth A and it appeared Youth A putting the
sock around her neck was Staff 1’s point where “he was not
messing around anymore”. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 pulled Youth A
into her bedroom. Staff 2 reported Youth A’s bedroom was
already cleared out of items as Youth A has a pattern of self-harm.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 began throwing items out of Youth A’s
bedroom as if he were mad. She said she did not believe staff
were allowed to drag youth. Staff 2 reported while Staff 1 was in
Youth A’s bedroom, there was a “tussle”. Staff 2 explained
“tussle” as Youth A was trying to get out of her bedroom and Staff
1 was not letting her. Staff 2 reported when Staff 1 first got Youth
A into her bedroom, Staff 1 “man handled” Youth A to get her to
stay in her room. Staff 2 explained “man handle” as “like he threw
her, shoved her away from the door”. Staff 2 reported she thought
Staff 1 was “a little excessive”.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage in the foyer/living room area at the facility on
1/5/2025 was reviewed on 1/9/2024. Staff 1 and Staff 2 go to
escort Youth A. Youth A is laying prone on the kitchen floor. Staff
7

1 puts his arm under Youth A’s armpit, Staff 2 does the same.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 lift Youth A off the ground as per video it
appears Youth A remains “limp” and not willingly moving in the
escort. Youth A is lifted to a kneeling position. Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempt to move Youth A in this position however Staff 2 stops.
Staff 2 releases her hook position and Youth A lays on her back
on the ground. Staff 2 can be heard saying “drag her”, “drag her
that way” when Staff 1 took Youth A’s left wrist in his left hand and
her right wrist in his right hand and drags Youth A on the floor.
Staff 1 stopped dragging Youth A in the entry way and Staff 2
stated “it would be easier if you got up and walked”. Staff 1 lets
Youth A wrist go and Youth A laid on the floor in the entry way.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempt again to go back into an escort position
and assist Youth A off the floor however Youth A remained limp
and began stomping on Staff 2’s foot. Staff 1 and Staff 2 released
Youth A. Youth A sat on the floor in the entry way. Youth A took
off her sock and wrapped it around her neck. Staff 1 reached
down and grabbed the sock from Youth A, grabbed Youth A’s left
wrist with both of his hands and dragged Youth A to her bedroom.
Staff 2 followed. Staff 1 dragged Youth A into her bedroom.
Video footage outside Youth A’s bedroom on 1/5/2025 was
reviewed on 1/9/2025. Youth A was in her bedroom with Staff 1.
Youth A attempted to crawl out of her bedroom. Staff 1 grabbed
Youth A by the back of the shirt and pulled Youth A back into the
bedroom. Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s arm. Youth A attempted to
get away from Staff 1, Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s ankle and
dragged Youth A back into the bedroom. Staff 2 came to the door
with a chair. Staff 2 stands in the doorway.
Documents Reviewed:
• Physical Restraint Policy: only physical restraints that are
instructed in the approved Handle with Care Physical
Intervention Manual can be utilized. Corporal punishment-
such as any physical force including but not limited to
hitting or striking, paddling, shaking, slapping, spanking,
throwing, kicking, pulling or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Reported for Youth A dated 1/5/2025: Staff 1 dragged
Youth A across the floor to Youth A’s bedroom.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per video footage and
interviews, Staff 1 dragged Youth A to her bedroom.
8

While Youth A was in her bedroom and attempted to leave, Staff 1
grabbed Youth A and pulled her back into the bedroom by
dragging her again.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff placed youth in an unwarranted restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 1/9/2025. Chief Administrator reported she watched
the video footage of the restraint Staff 1 placed Youth A into in the
kitchen. Chief Administrator reported several concerns after
watching the video footage including the restraint being
unwarranted.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Supervisor reported she did not see the restraint occur
via video footage as it was occurring. Supervisor reported she
was unaware the restraint was unwarranted until reviewing video
footage of the incident after the incident. Supervisor reported
Youth A was throwing plastic cups on the floor when Staff 1
placed Youth A in the restraint.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth A reported she was in the kitchen and throwing
stuff onto the floor. Youth A reported she went to throw the
microwave on the floor and Staff 1 placed her in a restraint. Youth
A reported Staff 2 was present.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 1 reported he restrained Youth A as he thought Youth A was
going for a plate or microwave to break. Staff 1 reported he was
concerned for Youth A’s safety. Staff 1 reported the facility’s
9

policy regarding when staff can restrain has changed over time as
staff used to be able to restrain for property damage and now the
facility is no longer allowed to. Staff 1 reported he was concerned
if Youth A broke glass plates or the microwave that Youth A would
get a piece of the broken object to self-harm with due to Youth A's
history of self-harming. Staff 1 reported he thought the incident
was life threatening.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 2 reported Youth A reached into the cupboards and was
throwing plastic cups on the floor when Staff 1 restrained her.
Staff 2 reported restraints are only supposed to be done in life-or-
death situations, and she did not feel the incident warranted a
restraint. Staff 2 reported she felt Staff 1 was “excessive” during
the whole incident. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 has been
employed at the facility longer than her. Staff 2 reported she did
not say anything during the incident as she thought Supervisor
was watching the whole incident on the camera while it was
happening.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage in the kitchen on 1/5/2025 was reviewed on
1/9/2025. Youth A began sliding items off the kitchen counter onto
the floor and throwing bowls onto the floor. Youth A hit the
counter with her elbows. Youth A threw a pan on the floor. Youth
A opened the cupboard and threw a stack of plastic cups on the
floor. Youth A went to grab another stack of plastic cups and Staff
1 went behind Youth A and wrapped his arms around Youth A’s
upper torso and turned Youth A and took Youth A to the ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Physical Restraint Policy: Emergency restraints are the use
of a restraint as a lifesaving response for a youth. The
facility deems these restraints allowable in the following
situations: an emergency response to protect the youth or
others from an unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places youth or others in serious threat or
violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Reported for Youth A dated 1/5/2025 at 8:05pm: Youth A
grabbed several cups out of the cupboard and Staff 1
conducted an improper PRT taking Youth A to the ground.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 204620239 dated 1/5/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A was in the kitchen tossing items from the counter
10

and cupboards. Staff 1 put Youth A in a bearhug and took
Youth A down to the floor.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Youth A was placed in
an unwarranted restraint by Staff 1 as Youth A was throwing items
off the kitchen counter and cups out of the cupboard when Staff 1
initiated the restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Description (e) Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth's airway.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff placed youth in two prone restraints.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Supervisor reported while reviewing the video footage
she saw Staff 1 placed Youth A in a prone restraint. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 knows prone restraints are prohibited.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth A reported when Staff 1 restrained her in the
kitchen, Staff 1 pushed her to the ground, and she was laying on
her belly (prone). Youth A reported Staff 1 had his hand on her
back and was not placing any pressure on her. Youth A reported
she was not hurt at all during the incident and did not have any
injuries. Youth A reported she did not remember being restrained
a second time in her bedroom.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth B reported he was in his bedroom and did not see
much of the incident. Youth B reported Staff 1 called Youth B out
of his bedroom and told him to turn the lights off in the house.
Youth B reported while he was turning the lights off, Staff 1 yelled
for Staff 2 saying “weapon, she is trying to cut her throat”. Youth
B reported he saw Staff 1 go into Youth A’s bedroom and restrain
Youth A. Youth B reported as he walked by Youth A was on the
floor on her stomach (prone) and Staff 1 was on the side of her.
11

Youth B reported he did not see where Staff 1’s hands were
placed or how he was holding Youth A in the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 1 reported when he restrained Youth A in the kitchen, he and
Youth A fell to the ground and Youth A was on her stomach (in a
prone position) for about twenty seconds. Staff 1 reported he had
his right hand on Youth A’s back with no pressure on her. Staff 1
reported he had his hand on Youth A’s back, so Youth A knew he
was there. Staff 1 reported he did not think the facility was
allowed to do prone restraints however it was a “heat of the
moment” situation, and he did not think about it. Staff 1 reported
the restraint in the bedroom was performed the same way as the
restraint in the kitchen. Staff 1 explained the restraint as a bear
hug that went to the ground with Youth A in a prone position.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/9/2025.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 placed Youth A in a bear hug and took
Youth A to the ground. Staff 2 reported Youth A was laying on her
stomach (prone). Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was on the left side of
Youth A. Staff 2 did not think Staff 1 held Youth A down on the
ground. Staff 2 reported while Youth A was in her bedroom, Staff
1 yelled for her as Youth A had a nail and was trying to put the nail
in her neck. Staff 2 reported she went to Youth A’s bedroom and
Staff 1 and Youth A were on the ground. Staff 2 did not think Staff
1 restrained Youth A in the bedroom.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage in the kitchen on 1/5/2025 was reviewed on
1/9/2025. Youth A went to grab another stack of plastic cups and
Staff 1 went behind Youth A and wrapped his arms around Youth
A’s upper torso and turned Youth A and took Youth A to the
ground. Youth A landed on the ground with Staff 1’s upper body
across Youth A’s back. Staff 1 quickly transitioned off Youth A’s
back as Youth A was prone on the ground. Staff 1 kneels over
Youth A with his right hand on Youth A’s right lower back and his
left hand bent with his forearm in between Youth A’s right side and
arm. Staff 1 remained in this position for approximately twenty
seconds while he talked to Youth A. Staff 1 removed his hands
from Youth A and kneeled next to Youth A.
Video footage outside Youth A’s bedroom on 1/5/2025 was
reviewed on 1/9/2025. Staff 1 entered Youth A’s bedroom; it is
unclear exactly what occurs as there is only a small area that can
be seen. Youth A is laying prone on the floor with Staff 1 over her.
Staff 1 calls for Staff 2 and stated Youth A had a weapon. Staff 2
12

arrived, and Staff 1 handed the object to Staff 2. Staff 1 appeared
to release Youth A and get up.
Documents Reviewed:
• Physical Restraint Policy: only physical restraints that are
instructed in the approved Handle with Care Physical
Intervention Manual can be utilized. The agency strictly
prohibits restraining youth in a prone position.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 204620239 dated 1/5/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A was in the kitchen tossing items from the counter
and cupboards. Staff 1 put Youth A in a bearhug and took
Youth A down to the floor. Youth A was on her stomach
and Staff 1 immediately let go but kept his hands on Youth
A's back.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 204120238 dated 1/5/2025 for Youth A is
consistent with the facility’s internal incident reported for
Youth A dated 1/5/2025 at 9:16pm however the restraint is
marked as standing, not prone.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews and video
footage, Staff 1 placed Youth A in a prone restraint in the kitchen
and in Youth A’s bedroom.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Title prohibitions; reduction and elimination
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (10) Designated areas used for seclusion must be suicide-
Description resistant and protrusion-free.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not allow youth to exit her bedroom.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Supervisor reported Staff 1 is aware the facility is not
allowed to seclude youth.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/9/2025. Youth A reported after Staff 1 dragged her into her
13

bedroom, Staff 1 walked out of her bedroom, closed the door and
stood outside holding the door handle so Youth A could not get
